intro: Sporobolus altissimus, commonly known as giant sandreed, is a perennial grass native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that contain both male and female flowers, typical of grasses. Its deep root system allows it to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils, making it a common species in desert environments. Sporobolus altissimus is also known for its ability to stabilize dunes and prevent soil erosion.
